definitions: animals' offspring before reaching adult maturity or independence
younger members of a group considered as a collective entity
examples: The lioness fiercely protected her young from predators
Most birds abandon their young after they learn to fly
The village elders passed down traditions to the young
Programs were designed to engage the young in community service

definitions: basic monetary unit of China officially called renminbi
examples: The product costs fifty yuan in Chinese markets
Exchange rates showed one dollar equals seven yuan

definitions: large peninsula in southeastern Mexico separating Gulf of Mexico from Caribbean
examples: Ancient Mayan ruins dot the Yucatan peninsula's landscape
Tourists flock to Yucatan for its beaches and history

definitions: person from the former country of Yugoslavia before its dissolution
examples: Many Yugoslavs emigrated during the civil wars
His grandfather was a Yugoslav diplomat in the 1970s

definitions: former socialist federal republic in southeastern Europe that existed from 1918 to 1992
examples: Yugoslavia broke apart into several independent nations
Tito ruled Yugoslavia for nearly four decades

definitions: person from or relating to the former country of Yugoslavia
examples: The Yugoslavian embassy closed after the country dissolved
She collected Yugoslavian stamps from the communist era

definitions: federal territory in northwestern Canada known for wilderness and gold rush history
examples: The Yukon Territory attracts adventurers seeking wilderness experiences
Gold prospectors flooded into Yukon during the Klondike rush

definitions: archaic or poetic term for Christmas or the Christmas season
examples: The family gathered around the yule log on Christmas Eve
Traditional yule celebrations lasted twelve days in medieval times

definitions: numerical code used in postal addresses for mail sorting
sliding fastener consisting of interlocking metal or plastic teeth
vigor, energy, or liveliness in movement or expression
informal term meaning nothing or zero amount
examples: Please include your zip code on the envelope
The zip code 90210 became famous through television
The jacket's zip got stuck halfway up
She repaired the broken zip with pliers
The team played with real zip in the second half
Adding lemon gives the sauce extra zip
The home team scored zip in the first quarter
His promises turned out to be worth zip

definitions: capital and largest city of Croatia located in the northwest
examples: Zagreb hosts many international business conferences each year
The cathedral in Zagreb dominates the city skyline

definitions: former name of Democratic Republic of Congo from 1971 to 1997
examples: Zaire was renamed after Mobutu's regime ended
The currency of Zaire experienced severe hyperinflation

definitions: fourth longest river in Africa flowing through six countries to Indian Ocean
examples: Victoria Falls forms where the Zambezi plunges into a gorge
The Zambezi River supports diverse wildlife along its banks

definitions: landlocked country in southern Africa formerly known as Northern Rhodesia
examples: Zambia gained independence from Britain in 1964
Copper mining drives much of Zambia's economy

definitions: person from Zambia or relating to the country
examples: The Zambian government announced new mining regulations
Many Zambians work in the copper mining industry

definitions: machine that resurfaces ice rinks by shaving and flooding the surface
examples: The zamboni cleaned the ice between hockey periods
Driving the zamboni requires special training and certification

definitions: semi-autonomous archipelago off Tanzania's coast in the Indian Ocean
examples: Zanzibar's spice markets attract tourists from around the world
Stone Town in Zanzibar is a UNESCO World Heritage site

definitions: ancient Persian prophet and founder of Zoroastrianism also known as Zoroaster
examples: Zarathustra taught the concept of dualism between good and evil
Nietzsche's book features Zarathustra as a philosophical character

definitions: largest island of Denmark where Copenhagen is located
part of the country name New Zealand in the Pacific
examples: Copenhagen airport serves the entire Zealand region
The bridge connects Zealand to Sweden across the strait
New Zealand consists of North Island and South Island
Captain Cook mapped the coastline of New Zealand

definitions: informal term for a person from New Zealand also called Kiwi
examples: New Zealanders are known for their outdoor lifestyle
Many Zealanders emigrate to Australia for work opportunities

definitions: person who shows excessive zeal or fanatical devotion to a cause
member of ancient Jewish sect that resisted Roman rule
examples: Political zealots disrupted the peaceful protest
Health zealots often alienate others with extreme views
The Zealots fought against Roman occupation of Judea
Historical accounts describe Zealots defending Masada fortress

definitions: defining spirit or mood of a particular period reflected in ideas and beliefs
examples: The film perfectly captured the zeitgeist of the 1960s
Social media shapes the zeitgeist of modern youth culture

definitions: school of Mahayana Buddhism emphasizing meditation and intuition
state of calm attentiveness and intuitive insight
examples: She studied Zen Buddhism at a monastery in Japan
Zen masters teach through paradoxical questions called koans
Finding her zen helped her manage workplace stress
The garden's design creates a zen atmosphere for meditation

definitions: soft gentle breeze especially from the west
lightweight cotton or worsted fabric with fine texture
examples: A pleasant zephyr cooled the afternoon heat
Zephyrs rustled through the wheat fields at sunset
Her summer dress was made of printed zephyr
The zephyr curtains billowed in the morning air

definitions: large rigid airship named after German inventor Count von Zeppelin
British rock band Led Zeppelin active from 1968 to 1980
examples: The Hindenburg zeppelin disaster ended the airship era
Military zeppelins bombed London during World War I
Led Zeppelin pioneered hard rock and heavy metal music
The band took their name from the airship term

definitions: landlocked country in southern Africa formerly known as Rhodesia
examples: Zimbabwe gained independence from Britain in 1980
Victoria Falls lies on the border between Zimbabwe and Zambia

definitions: person from Zimbabwe or relating to the country
examples: Zimbabwean artists have gained international recognition
The Zimbabwean dollar experienced severe hyperinflation

definitions: black-skinned wine grape variety grown especially in California producing robust red wines
examples: California zinfandel pairs perfectly with barbecued meats
White zinfandel is actually made from red zinfandel grapes

definitions: hill in Jerusalem where the city of David was built
Jewish homeland or the Jewish people collectively
idealized place of peace and liberation in various contexts
examples: Mount Zion holds deep significance in Jewish tradition
Pilgrims have visited Zion for thousands of years
The movement to establish Zion began in the nineteenth century
Many songs reference Zion as the promised homeland
Rastafarians view Ethiopia as their spiritual Zion
The novel depicted Zion as humanity's last free city

definitions: movement for establishing and supporting a Jewish national homeland in Palestine
examples: Zionism led to the establishment of Israel in 1948
Theodore Herzl is considered the father of modern Zionism

definitions: person who supports or advocates for Zionism and Jewish self-determination
examples: Early Zionists purchased land in Palestine for settlements
The conference brought together Zionists from forty countries

definitions: ancient Persian prophet who founded Zoroastrianism also called Zarathustra
examples: Zoroaster preached monotheism in ancient Persia
The teachings of Zoroaster influenced later religions

definitions: person who follows Zoroastrianism or relating to this ancient Persian religion
examples: Zoroastrians maintain sacred fires in their temples
The Zoroastrian community in India is called Parsi

definitions: ancient Persian religion founded by Zoroaster based on worship of Ahura Mazda
examples: Zoroastrianism influenced the development of Judaism and Christianity
Fire temples are central to Zoroastrianism worship practices

definitions: largest ethnic group in South Africa with rich cultural traditions
Bantu language spoken by the Zulu people
letter Z in the NATO phonetic alphabet
examples: The Zulu kingdom resisted colonial expansion for decades
Zulu warriors were famous for their military tactics
She learned to speak Zulu while living in KwaZulu-Natal
Zulu uses click consonants characteristic of southern African languages
The pilot said 'Zulu' to indicate the letter Z
Military time uses Zulu to mean UTC or GMT

definitions: largest city in Switzerland and major global financial center
examples: International banks have headquarters in Zurich
Zurich airport serves as a major European hub

definitions: nocturnal burrowing mammal native to Africa that feeds on ants and termites
examples: The aardvark uses its long tongue to catch insects
Aardvarks can dig burrows quickly with their powerful claws

definitions: large edible sea snail with an ear-shaped shell prized for meat and mother-of-pearl
examples: Divers harvest abalone along the California coast
The restaurant served grilled abalone with garlic butter

definitions: act of giving up completely or leaving something permanently behind
complete lack of inhibition or restraint in behavior
examples: The abandon of the sinking ship saved many lives
Child abandon cases increased during the economic crisis
She danced with wild abandon at the celebration
The children played with joyful abandon in the snow

definitions: act of leaving someone or something permanently without intending to return
voluntary relinquishment of property or rights without naming a successor
psychological state resulting from being deserted or neglected
examples: The abandonment of pets increases during vacation seasons
Urban abandonment left many buildings vacant and deteriorating
Property abandonment occurs when owners stop paying taxes
The abandonment of the trademark allowed competitors to use it
Childhood abandonment often leads to attachment issues in adults
Fear of abandonment can affect personal relationships

definitions: act of reducing or lessening in amount, intensity, or degree
temporary suspension or reduction of legal proceedings or penalties
elimination or reduction of a nuisance or environmental hazard
examples: Noise abatement measures were implemented near the airport
The storm showed no signs of abatement throughout the night
The court granted a tax abatement for the historic property
Rent abatement was offered during the renovation period
Asbestos abatement requires specialized contractors and equipment
The city ordered immediate abatement of the health hazard

definitions: building where animals are butchered for meat production
examples: The abattoir processes thousands of cattle each week
Strict hygiene standards govern abattoir operations

definitions: loose over-garment worn by some Muslim women covering the entire body
examples: She chose a black abaya embroidered with gold thread
The abaya is commonly worn in Gulf countries

definitions: building or buildings occupied by monks or nuns under religious vows
community of monks or nuns living under religious vows
examples: Westminster Abbey hosts royal coronations and weddings
The medieval abbey ruins attract thousands of tourists
The abbey followed strict Benedictine rules
She joined the abbey after years of contemplation

definitions: man who is head of an abbey of monks
examples: The abbot led morning prayers in the chapel
Medieval abbots wielded considerable political influence

definitions: shortened form of a word or phrase used for brevity
examples: The abbreviation USA stands for United States of America
Medical records often contain abbreviations that confuse patients

definitions: formal relinquishment of monarchical power and position
failure to fulfill or undertake a duty or responsibility
examples: King Edward's abdication shocked the British nation
The abdication ceremony was broadcast on television
His abdication of parental duties harmed the children
The board viewed it as an abdication of leadership

definitions: muscles in the belly region between chest and pelvis
examples: Daily abdominal exercises strengthen your core
The surgeon examined the patient's abdominal area

definitions: unlawful seizure and detention of a person against their will
form of logical inference that seeks the simplest explanation
movement of a limb away from the midline of the body
examples: The abduction occurred in broad daylight near the school
Police investigated the child abduction case urgently
Scientific discovery often involves abduction rather than deduction
Abduction helps generate hypotheses from observations
Shoulder abduction is limited after the injury
The physical therapist tested hip abduction range

definitions: person who unlawfully seizes and detains someone against their will
muscle that moves a body part away from the body's midline
examples: The abductor demanded ransom for the victim's release
Security cameras captured images of the abductor
The hip abductor helps stabilize walking movements
Strengthening abductors improves athletic performance

definitions: something that deviates from what is normal or expected
examples: The scientist studied aberrants in the genetic sequence
Statistical aberrants were removed from the data set
